intro: Ambrina tenuis, commonly known as the slender ambrina, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to certain regions of southern Europe and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a mild aromatic scent when crushed. Ambrina tenuis is often found in association with other wildflowers in its native environment.
